definition: to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]

sentences.english: Bells were tolled all over the country at the King's death.
sentences.chinese: 全国为国王之死而鸣钟。

sentences.english: Awake, O bell! proclaim the hour.
Hardly had the bell struck the ten, the old man sat on the table in the sitting room.
sentences.chinese: 自鸣钟敲了十下，老人已经稳稳的坐在客厅里的桌前。

sentences.english: The chime clock ticks away on the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 自鸣钟在搁板上滴答滴答地响著。

sentences.english: The Scots like to ring in the New Year.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰人喜欢鸣钟迎新年。

sentences.english: All these things are sounding the bell for the earth changes.
sentences.chinese: 所有的一切都为地球的改变而鸣钟。

definition: to perform music/to play a tune
lit. morning bell, evening drum, symbolizing monastic practice (idiom); fig. encouragement to study or progress
to beat a gong/to sound the retreat
to herald the break of day
